title: A new Visual approach to pendulum period determination
authors:
Rodrigo S\'anchez-Mart\'inez (1) and Esteban Heredia-Mu\~noz (2) ((1)
  Universidad Nacional Aut\'onoma de M\'exico, Ciudad de M\'exico, M\'exico,
  (2) Universidad Veracruzana, Xalapa, M\'exico)
abstract:
The period of oscillation of a simple pendulum ($T = 2\pi\sqrt{l/g}$) is a
familiar formula to the average first-year physics student. However, deriving
this expression from first principles involves solving a non-linear
differential equation using the small angle approximation, which may appear
obscure to a student in the early stages of learning calculus. Therefore, we
propose an alternative approach to the derivation of this formula employing
geometry, algebra, and physical intuition. Our method follows the ideas of the
fathers of calculus, replacing the circular path of the pendulum with a
successive collection of infinitesimal inclined planes and summing the travel
times of each plane in the limit as the number of planes becomes very large.
Notably, the evaluation of this limit relies solely on geometry, making it
accessible to any student, even those not yet familiar with calculus
techniques.
